result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Roy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J Roy

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Regular

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan J Roy in court with Attorney Jack A. Umpleby.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court examines DE. Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored. Defendant pleads guilty, court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Case rescheduled from 8/13/2014 to 8/7/2014. Atty. Umpleby requested disposition date earlier than 8/13/2014.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
